fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59412].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using List View of Issue Navigator, the user has the ability to select fields to add as Columns to the list.

The Columns drop down selector can only display 25 fields at any time. In order to see more, the user is prompted with a message as follows:

_+## more options. Continue typing to refine further.+_

In the circumstance where a user is trying to search for a value (e.g. "*Type*"), but the environment has *more* than 25 fields (including Custom Fields) which have the word "Type" as part of the value, the user may not be able to find "*Type*" in the list. Yet they cannot refine further by adding more characters; they are only looking for "*Type*".

This impacts users with a large number of custom fields in their environment, who might stumble into this issue.



h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create one custom field with a specific name (e.g. "Type")
# Create at least 25 other custom fields with any combination of characters, *followed by* "Type" (e.g. "Example Type")
# Go to the Issue Navigator, and be in List View.
# Click the Columns dropdown, and search for "Type"


h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to select "Type". This could be accomplished by either:

* Changing the search logic to order results *starting* with the search criteria at the top
* Allowing the user to expand the search results without typing (e.g. +_Click to refine further_+)


h3. Actual Results

The user is prompted to continue typing to refine further. Any further typing beyond "*Type*" will result in a non-match for the value "*Type*", making it impossible to select this value.


h3.Workaround

# Rename the custom field to something else which does not cause this issue in the Column search.
# Add this renamed field as a column to the List View in the Issue Navigator
# Rename the custom field back to what it originally was
fields.summary: See more available fields for Columns in List View of Issue Navigator without typing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59402].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Before JIRA 7, JIRA was shipped with JSP files where customization in [JIRA templates and JSPs|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/jira-templates-and-jsps] is possible. In JIRA 7, it's all compiled and there is no JSP files shipped together with the installer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship JSP files like how it does in JIRA 6 and etc.

h3. Note
* JIRA 6.4.x, the path is {{[JIRA Installation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-installation-directory-189891102.html]\work\Catalina\localhost_\org\apache\jsp}}.
* For JIRA 7, the path is {{[JIRA Installation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-installation-directory-189891102.html]\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\jsp}}.
fields.summary: JSP files are missing in JIRA 7

  {panel}


h3. Summary:
Currently, when JIRA process an email in the configured mail handler, it is either create a new ticket in the instance or silently reject the mail with some information written in the logs. Hence, it will be great if there is a notification to the sender if their email is rejected, such as how when an user is not allowed to access a certain page in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configured JIRA Incoming Mail
# Make sure that the "Create Users" function is disabled
# Send an email to the Incoming Mail Address as an Unregistered User

h3. Current Result:
* JIRA will process it and mark it as read, but the ticket is not created. The information why will be found on the logs.

h3. Desired Result:
* JIRA will process it and mark it as read, but the ticket is not created. There will be a notification to the sender that the email has been rejected.

h3. Note:
* This should apply to JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler as well.
fields.summary: "Your Mail is Rejected" Notification

h3. Summary

 !bug.PNG|thumbnail!

I have verified the icon images are not present in the specified directory.

h3. Summary
When you perform set postfunction to use update issue field, the description field does not follow the wiki format accordingly

h3. Environment
* 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create an issue and insert this code to the description:
{code}
||Misto zmeny||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena||
|KBI| | |N/A| | |	
|DCS| | |N/A| | |
|CMS| | |N/A| | |
|PCBS| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|MKTG1,2| | | |N/A| |
|Obch.prod.| | | |N/A| |
{code}
# edit a sample workflow and go to the create transition
# add Update issue Field postfunction
# insert the same text from step1 into the field Description
# publish draft workflow
# create new issue using the workflow that was modified in previous steps
# take a look at field description after issue creation

h3. Expected Results
The value in the description field should following according to the wiki format which is something like the following (wiki format):
{code}
||Misto zmeny||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena||
|KBI| | |N/A| | |	
|DCS| | |N/A| | |
|CMS| | |N/A| | |
|PCBS| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A|
|MKTG1,2| | | |N/A| |
|Obch.prod.| | | |N/A| |
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The table is broken because post function Update Issue Field does not support new lines (table MUST contain new lines otherwise will be corrupted) and corrupted table with one row which you will see something like the following (wiki format):
{code}
||*Misto zmeny*||Zadani||Aktualizace zadani - TPS||Gestor PS stop||Zmena provedena||Kontrola provedena|||*KBI*| | |N/A| | | |*DCS*| | |N/A| | | |*CMS*| | |N/A| | | |*PCBS*| |N/A|N/A|N/A|N/A| |*MKTG1,2*| |N/A| | | | |*Obch.prod.*| |N/A| | | |
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59385].
  {panel}

In the *[Restoring a Project from Backup document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/restoring-a-project-from-backup-185729444.html]*, it can be read:

{quote}
You cannot import a project directly from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server — the importer will display errors about version mismatches. If you want to restore a project from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server, follow the steps below:

   # Install a new JIRA Server instance (in addition to the one that you want to import your project into). This will be a temporary instance that is used to store a full JIRA import from JIRA Cloud. Ensure that the version of this temporary instance matches the version of the JIRA instance that you want to import your project into, e.g. JIRA 6.2.
   # Do a full JIRA migration from JIRA Cloud to the temporary JIRA Server instance. See Migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server.
   # Export the entire JIRA Server instance.
   # Import the project into your desired JIRA Server instance, by following the instructions in the Restoring your project section below. 
   # (optional) Delete the temporary JIRA Server instance, once the project has completed 
{quote}

This information is incorrect. It's not possible to import a backup from JIRA Cloud to an old version of JIRA Server, specially the 6.2. It's recommended, and sometimes only possible, to restore a JIRA Cloud backup in the latest JIRA Server version.

It's important to make clear that it's not supported and furthermore not possible to use the Project import tool to import data from newer JIRA versions to older JIRA versions.

Regards,
Teilor
fields.summary: Correct the misleading informartion on the KB about Project Import

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59371].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

From time to time users notice that issues have been deleted, and would like to be able to see who deleted the issue, and when it was deleted.

This could also be useful for pinpointing which backup could be used to [perform a recovery of a deleted issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Recovering+Single+deleted+issues+from+JIRA+Backups].
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an audit log for Issue Deletion.

Further possible outcome: Allow for deleted issues to be restored.


h3. Workaround
There are two workaround here:

# First is to use Webhooks, Then you can audit all the changes you need to even select some of them.
# Second is to go to the instance home page at https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa then scroll down, you will see the activity stream which has a RSS.
fields.summary: Provide an Audit Log for Deleted Issues in JIRA

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-issue-level-security-185729623.html
This page contains this:
bq.  (A security level of 'None' means that anybody can see the issue.)
What does it means 'anybody'.
It's viewable without authentication?
Or it's viewable for all authenticated users?
Or it is viewable for all project members?
I think it's based on several system settings, but I've not found any page in your documentation where it was specified exactly. I think you should define on this page.
fields.summary: On 'Configuring Issue-level Security' page 'anybody' is unspecified for None security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59366].
  {panel}

As a JIRA admin, we are used to receive  requests from users asking to access a project, but we are not able to know if the user really can access the project and which role the user should be applied for.

So, we forward the request to the project lead (also in project administrator role), asking to provide the proper access to the user.

Suggestion.
1 User go to PROJECTS menu and select the desired project
2 JIRA shows a screen saying the user does not have access to the project and there is a button where user can send a notification to the project administrators (role) justifing why the user need to access that project.
3 Project admin receives by email the access request, and add the user to the proper role
4 Project admin can reply the email to the user.
fields.summary: Option for users to request project access directly to project Lead

h3. Problem Definition
Make possible to limit the download size for files generated by JIRA in an issue.
When user use the *download all attachments* option in a JIRA issue it generates a zip file. If this file is too large it will drop the application.

h3. Suggested Solution
Limit the size file for downloading.

h3. Workaround 
Hide that option by disabling zip support in JIRA.
# Go to Administration;
# Attachments:
# Edit Settings;
# Enable ZIP support (OFF).
fields.summary: Limit the download size for the zip file generated on JIRA issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59332].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Importing issues using CSV returns error when username contains space

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version {{7.1.0-OD-04-012}} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with a space in their username (e.g: john doe)
# Select *Import Issues from CSV* from *Issues* blue menu bar.
# Upload *CSV Source File*. Click _Next_.
# Select any project. Click _Next_.
# Map appropriate fields and click _Next_.
# Click _Validate_

h3. Expected Results
No error is retured.

h3. Actual Results
Error is returned:
{noformat}
The validation process has found 1 error/s:

Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ The reporter specified is not a user. ]
{noformat}

or
{noformat}
The validation process has found 1 error/s:

Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ User 'johndoe' does not exist. ]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Trying to escape the space with {{' '}} or {{" "}} or {{/ /}} doesn't work as well.

* The documentation on *Importing Issues* also does not specify whether this is allowed or not:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html

h3.Workaround
* Remove the space in the username
fields.summary: Importing issues using CSV returns error when username contains space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59330].
  {panel}

*Context:*
The issue creation via the "+ Create issue" (see screenshot) automatically sets Component, FixVersion whenever the board filter mentions one (and only one).
A problem turns up when using one-word components. Differently from muliple-word components, these are NOT added to the create dialog. The absence of double quotes to wrap the Component name appears to trigger this problem.

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Create a board that uses a filter like this one: _Project  = [any one project] and Component = [any one single-word component defined on the project]_
* Go on the Backlog view and hit the button "+Create issue" and then the button "..." (open create dialog)

*Expected behaviour:*
The component field is pre-filled with [any one single-word component defined on the project]

*Actual behaviour:*
The component field is empty

*Notice that*
If the board filter mentions a muliple-word components (insetad of a single-word), the entire flow works fine
fields.summary: Inline issue creation doesn't add one-word Components even when board filter specifies one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59326].
  {panel}

Hi there
given the level of rights you can manipulate with PARTICIPANT functionality (adding to Permission or issue schemes), it would seem really sensible to have "Modify Participant" as a stand alone permission area, just as you currently have "Modify Reporter"

Customers with several login accounts could then add a participant by choice where we do not allow them to EDIT the full issue (only transition and comments) in the service desk. At this time we would need to manage this for them which creates an necessary overhead for our analysts. In addition this would also help work with enterprise customers who expect to have several individual accounts able to operate easily "together"

This seems to be a real gap in this design to the use of this collaboration tool - it could be doing more for us!!
fields.summary: Create a permission layer of "Modify Participant" as we have for "Modify Reporter"

h3. Summary

h3. Suggestion
Upon AppLink creation in JIRA, create some default set of triggers where users have a choice to either
* Use them
* Don't use them
* Customize them
fields.summary: More user friendly configuration for triggers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59321].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes Projects in JIRA do not use Bamboo for Release Management, but others do use Bamboo for this purpose. Also, users of those Projects may not have all of the necessary permissions, or it is not desired for those users to use Bamboo or Releasing Versions. However, this is not currently possible. The connection to Bamboo is a global addition to a JIRA environment. Some users would like to configure Bamboo on a Project by Project basis.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Configure Bamboo for only desired Projects when releasing a version.
fields.summary: Remove Bamboo from certain JIRA Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59319].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition

Cannot use the custom field *Select List (multiple choices)* as a means of entering emails and assigning to [Group Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html] in a notification schemes. Email alerts will not works. There is no a way to restrict the values entered in the Select list to just email addresses.

The only two custom fields allowed for Group Custom Field values are: Group Picker or Multi Group Picker. There is an [exception|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12865] when you can use the Select List and Muti Select list in Group Custom Field values is when custom fields store are exact users or group names.

There is not a way for end user to set up an email list using Select List and get the Group Custom Field value to properly send out notifications.

h3. Suggested Solution

Either create a new Group Custom field to allow only email addresses or add functionality to the Select List (multi choice) to be able to be used with the group Custom field notification configuration. 
 
h3. Workaround 

No real workaround. Cannot add text email address as a way be triggered by the notification schemes. End user will need to add the email address as JIRA user.
fields.summary: Allow Select List email values to work with Group Custom Field in Notification Schemes
Not able to see parent task information on subtasks

fields.summary: Image attached to a comment will stick to the issue even if comment was never saved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59309].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian Team,

I use both internal url and external url for my Jira 7.0.5. Currently when I click on the Jira logo it always redirects me to Base URL. How can I change the behavior of that? 

For example: I log on internal url jira-internal.abc.com and when I click on the logo it will redirect me to dashboard and still keep my internal url.

Thanks and Best Regards.

Dung
fields.summary: Change Jira Logo URL

fields.summary: I can not access to issue Statuses in  "ISSUE ATTRIBUTES"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59304].
  {panel}

All fields that support user mentions are called "mentionable" fields.

Mentionable fields are initialised at one of two times:

* When DomContentLoaded occurs, or
* When the field is focussed by the end-user

This means that some mentionable fields have a chance to not get initialised if:

* The field did not exist in the DOM at the time DomContentLoaded occurred, and
* If the field is programmatically focussed, as opposed to focussed by the end-user.

This happens to be exactly what the "add comment" field does.
fields.summary: Mentions only initialise when the user focuses the field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59302].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA 7 allows for the feature flag: {{jira.downgrade.allowed=true}} to be enabled which will give JIRA Admins the option to downgrade JIRA. 

This feature is useful when a migration must occur for technical or operational reasons to an older version. 

The feature is not documented and should be be included in some of the following documentation's perhaps as an include. 

- [Upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications]
- [Migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Migrating+from+JIRA+Cloud+to+Server+applications]
- [Rolling back a JIRA application upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Rolling+back+a+JIRA+application+upgrade]

h3. Environment
JIRA 7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is a request to document a new product feature. 

h3. Expected Results
The possibility to downgrade a JIRA version should be made publicly available in the documentation. 

The limitations of this feature such as how far back the instance can be downgraded to should be indicated along with providing some sample usage scenarios.

h3. Actual Results
The flag: "jira.downgrade.allowed=true" and searching for relevant procedures does not return  meaningful results.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59295].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian team.

As I let you know in a support ticket (https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JSP/issue/JSP-249425), I've been struggling with a strange problem on the plugin I was developing for Jira.
Sometimes, not always, and not for all plugins, when I uninstall and reinstall a plugin (or reload it via FastDev), plugin usage raises the following exception :

{code}
Caused by: org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.ServiceProxyDestroyedException: service proxy has been destroyed
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor$ServiceLookUpCallback.doWithRetry(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:105)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.support.RetryTemplate.execute(RetryTemplate.java:83)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.lookupService(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:430)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.getTarget(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:415)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3232.find(Unknown Source)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.ovyka.jira.testplugin.dao.impl.ContextDAOImpl.getContextsForProjectAndIssueType(ContextDAOImpl.java:87)
{code}

At first I thought it was coming from the fact I was using Spring autowiring of beans inside my plugin, but declaring them as component (not shared) didn't change anything.

I have investigated more and finally found the cause (and solution) of the problem.

I ran a very deep debug session, going down into Spring Dynamic Modules, Spring Framework and Jira code. I found something really weird about the bundle context (context class of OSGi bundles, which is what Jira plugin really are) : the bundle being called when the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception was raised was NOT the currently deployed plugin version....

To illustrate this, I put some debug points in Felix (OSGi framework implementation used by Jira) BundleContextImpl class, in the invalidate() method (called when a plugin is uninstalled), and in the constructor (called when the plugin is installed). I also place a breakpoint in Spring Dynamic Modules ServiceDynamicInterceptor class, which is were the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception is raised. At each of these breakpoints, I took a "snapshot" of the bundle context for the bundle being used, and here is what came of it :

During uninstallation of a plugin, in BundleContextImpl.invalidate() method, the bundle context is as follows :
{code}
{org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41676} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41677} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [180]"
 m_valid = false

Note the OSGi id of the bundle com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin : 180

When installing the new version of the bundle, here is what I got in the BundleContextImpl constructor :
 {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41793} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41794} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [181]"
 m_valid = true
{code}

Note the OSGi id of the testplugin plugin is different : 181.

Now if i try to use a feature of my plugin, the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception raising breakpoint is hit, and the associated bundle context is :
{code}
 {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleContextImpl@41970} 
 m_logger = {com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixLoggerBridge@38134} 
 m_felix = {org.apache.felix.framework.Felix@38135} "org.apache.felix.framework [0]"
 m_bundle = {org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl@41985} "com.ovyka.jira.tesplugin [173]"
 m_valid = false
{code}

Note that the OSGi id is 173 (so not the uninstalled one, nore the newly installed one), and the bundle context is marked as invalid (m_valid = false).

What I concluded from this is that Jira was keeping a reference to every version of the plugin, and was calling one of them, wether or not it was the latest one.
Actually, after a little more digging, I found out it was not totally exact.
In fact, Jira DOES keep a reference to all the version of the plugin, but does not call one of them : it calls ALL of them.

When, after reaching the first ServiceProxyDestroyed raising breakpoint I let the application continue its work, the breakpoint was hit once again, with a different bundle context (180 in the example above).

After that, it is not called anymore, but the plugin feature work is done. Adding a breakpoint on the called plugin method that Jira was trying to execute, I found out it was actually called, with a different bundle context (181 in the example above), which is why no exception is raised, and the work is done.

So here is the updated conclusion :
Jira keeps a reference to all versions of a bundle (after multiple install/reinstall), and when the plugin is called, Jira calls all of the bundles, one by one.
* For all the inactive versions, a ServiceProxyDestroyed exception is raised (sometimes also ClassNotFound or NoClassDefFound, for classes that ARE in Jira provided classpath (Jira services references by plugins)).
* For the active version, the plugin does its work, without any exception.
So this exception is not blocking, as it does not prevent the work of the plugin to be done, but may be very dangerous, because if the plugin does not require any OSGi reference, no exception will be raised, and the work may done several times...

Now what was left to do was to know why all bundles were kept by Jira (increasing the amount of memory used, by the way). I climbed back the call stack from the ServiceProxyDestroyed raising point, and found out the source of the call was an IssueEventListener. After a small test, I found out the reason of the problem, and of course its solution.

The reason why Jira keeps a reference to all bundle versions is that, when a plugin adds an EventListener to jira, it has to register it into the EventPublisher :  eventPublisher.register(this);
This is not a process linked to OSGi. It is done "programatically", and none of the OSGi bundle uninstalling processes being aware of this link, the listener is NEVER unregistered from the EventPlublisher, if the developer does not unregister it : it stays in the list of listeners registered in Jira.

That explains why my plugin was called multiple times when I was doing an action triggering an IssueEvent. The EventPublisher was calling all of the registered IssueEventListeners, including the ones registered by removed plugins. And this explains also the ServiceProxyDestroyed exception, because when a bundle version is uninstalled, the ServiceProxy provided by Spring Dynamic Modules are actually destroyed, so all the services injected in the uninstalled plugin now are obsolete and linked to nothing.

The solution to this problem (actually one of the solutions) is very simple, and is given in your tutorial page (https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/guides/other/tutorial-writing-jira-event-listeners-with-the-atlassian-event-library) : Make the listener implement DisposableBean and implement the destroy() method with the line : eventPublisher.unregister(this);

I think you should emphasize the fact that this is very important, because given the number of pages about this ServiceProxyDestroyed exception around the net, I am not the only one to have missed this point :)

Now another solution to this problem would be to avoid asking developers to register their listener into the EventPublisher.

A very efficient way to do this would be to implement the OSGi White Board pattern. When developing a listener, the developer would just have to declare it in the atlassian-plugin.xml (for example, declare it using a <listener class=""/> tag, as it is done for rest endpoints), and Jira would just have to publish it as an OSGi service, with restricted access to Jira core only. Now the EventPublisher, instead of maintaining a list of registered listeners, which as we saw does not work well with the dynamic nature of OSGi bundles, would just ask for all services published under a specific marker interface, for example PluginJiraListener (just an example).
OSGi framework would then give it all services implementing this interface, which are available at the time the call is made by the EventPublisher.

This would require a modification of jira core or Jira plugin management plugin, but would avoid this problem and would be a much nicer way to deal with dynamic plugins.
And isn't it how this is done in Confluence ?

Would you consider doing this modification in Jira system ?
fields.summary: Avoid ServiceProxyDestroyed exceptions - event listener improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59291].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the exported data from *Issue Navigator* in JIRA, is not exporting date fields as *date* data type in Excel. According to Bartek Gatz in [JRA-11360|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11360], this is something that is being worked on actively by Atlassian. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement Excel exporting where data is formatted correctly. 

h3. Workaround 
Changing the data format manually in Excel _might_ be of help.
fields.summary: Dates should be formatted as Date data type during Export to Excel
aaa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59285].
  {panel}

There are two minor issues with the integration between [Confluence and the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-use-of-the-jira-issue-collector-296092376.html#AdvancedUseoftheJIRAIssueCollector-EmbeddingtheIssueCollector]: 

h5.Collector Position 

This one is related to the position that we will need the collector to be displayed in Confluence. When creating a new Issue Collector, one of the options that you can edit is the *Trigger Style*. However, once you have created and saved it, you will still have the *Edit* option, but, even changing the position for the trigger style, it will not be refreshed in Confluence. Even if you remove and add the new script, the position will be the same than the first time. 

The workaround is to create a new Issue Collector with the new position. 

h5.Collector Location

This one is a bit more aesthetic. When selecting the *Subtle* option for the Trigger Style, it will be displayed in the bottom of the page. However, if you edit this page, the collector will be in the same location of the *Close* or the *Save* button. This will make the user to scroll more in order to search for the options to finish the editing of the page.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Collector Integration with Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59281].
  {panel}

h3. Summarry

When clicking 'Today' in the calendar widget in the project version screen you get 01-JAN-1970. This is obviously wrong.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.

* Go to a project's versions.
* Click on Release Date.
* Click on 'Today' in the widget.
* _BUG_ You will notice the date changes to 01-JAN-1970.

h3. Actual Results.

The widget believes today is the 01-JAN-1970.

h3. Expected Results

Clicking on 'Today' from the widget should select today's date according the user's JIRA TZ.

h3. Workaround

Type in or select today's date manually.
fields.summary: When clicking 'Today' in the calendar widget in the project version screen you get 01-JAN-1970

When comparing JIRA 6.4.5 and JIRA Software 7.0.4, I found that autocomplete needs longer substring to show right option in at least one example.

Support tools
* to show it in JIRA 6.4.5, {{Supp}} was enough to display it
* to show it in JIRA Software 7.0.4, {{Support t}} was needed display it

The bug is shown at attached pictures.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59276].
  {panel}

*Summary*: There is no possibility to create ISSUE TYPE Scheme without associated ISSUE TYPE, BUT there is possibility to associate single issue type and then delete it. It brings us to situation that we don't have any TYPE in SCHEME and it can be reason of some issues like this one. When you try to create issue (and system is picking up project without issue type) you will see following error.

 !image-2016-01-07-20-06-38-177.png|thumbnail! 

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create Issue Type
 # Create Issue Type Scheme and pick up Issue Type you just created
 # Associate project WITHOUT any issue to this Scheme
 # Delete Issue Type
 # Try to create Issue (from dashboard please... it seems that there is little bit inconsistency because when you create issue from Admin page you will see different dialog... and different problem in this case)
 # Select project with scheme without issue type 

 

*Observed problem:*
 - If you are creating issue from dashboard system fails to display dialog (if last opened project was the one without issue type)
 - Same situation for inline issue creation
 - If you try to create issue from admin page you will see issue types for all projects (picture below).
 !image-2016-01-07-20-10-41-916.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Issue dialog failure - when Issue Type Scheme has NO issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59270].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence, there exists a quick search functionality where you can start typing in the search box and it will automatically find suggestions for you without ever having to hit *enter*.

h3. Suggested Solution
This does not exist in JIRA and would be nice to have implemented

h3. Workaround
There are a few add-ons for Server:
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.communardo.jira.quicksearch/server/overview
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icfilters.jira-icfilters/server/overview

Unfortunately, this does not exist for Cloud users.
fields.summary: Provide a JIRA automatic search functionality similar to that of Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59269].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When you delete or merge a version that has many issues assigned (for instance 200). The operation times out and an error message is shown.
However, the version is still being removed in an 'abandoned' request thread and finally disappears from the versions list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create at least 200 issues and set their fix version/s to A.
2. Delete version A from project administration.
3.*BUG* The operation will timeout in the UI, although the version will proceed and be successful in the background.

h3. Actual Results

The Delete/Merge Version operations time out when the number of issues involved is large.

h3. Expected Results

The UI operation does not time out regardless of the number of issues involved in the deletion or merging of versions.

 h3. Notes

This affects both version delete / merge. Cloud is more affected than server by this because the request time-out in the Cloud environment is shorter.
fields.summary: Deleting a version that has many issues assigned to it leads to a time out
HAProxy load balancer example cookie problems

h3. Summary
On a Dashboard gadget with a quick filter search "Saved Filter" entering a special character such as: + - ( ' ; " etc displays an error popup.
!char_breaks_search.jpeg!

It reads: "The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."


h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1
* Dashboard gadgets
* Confluence macros of JIRA with filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget to a dashboard (or any other gadget with filters)
# Type a special character

h3. Expected Results
Results window mentions that there are no results matching the search.

h3. Actual Results
* Popup with error appears on screen.
* Browser Console logs a 500 error

Entering a * or ? triggers a 400 (Bad Request) error instead of 500 (Internal Server Error). This is probably due to previous work to capture the error: [JRA-18317|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18317]
 
h3. Notes
* Working previously on JIRA v6.4 where * and ? cause 400 errors in the browser console but don't generate popup
* Errors while configuring Confluence macros won't trigger a popup but will generate a JIRA error.
* This is also reproducible for filters with names such as {{TeamA - new}}. The moment the user types {{TeamA -}}  on the saved filter field, then the above UI error pops up and the filter  {{TeamA - new}} is no longer suggested. 

h3.Workaround
* Select the option to "Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs"
fields.summary: Filter Search in gadgets returns 500 error with special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59263].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The quick search "Saved Filter" inside Gadgets is not listing all available filters that match the search criteria. It returns a list of 10 items that match the search criteria and then does consecutive searches over those first 10 items, missing filters that were not included in the first results.

h3. Affects
* JIRA 7.1
* Dashboard Gadgets
* Confluence Macros with JIRA filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 11 or more Filters that start with the same word. e.g: "Filter A","Filter B", etc
# Add the "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget to a Dashboard
# Search for the 11th filter by typing "Filter K"

h3. Expected Results
The Filter is found because the search matches the filter's name.

h3. Actual Results
* Typing the first name returns 10 filters. Good so far.
* Typing the start of the second word brings no results or a sub group of the previous 10 results.
 
h3. Notes
* Doesn't affect JIRA 6.4 and previous.
* Searching for "K" in the example, will find the 11th filter but if the site has another 10 filters with the letter K, it may not. Making it unsearchable.

h3.Workarounds
* Use the Advanced Search to find the filter (not available in Confluence macros)
* Add a unique word to the filter.
* Search for the second word. This will only work if the 10 results for the second word include the filter.
fields.summary: Filter Search in gadgets doesn't find all filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59262].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever you select a project from the "Projects" menu, it brings up what looks like the details view (with the issues list on the left, and the currently-selected issue on the right). You then need to click "view all issues and filters" to get back to the List View.

h3. Suggested Solution
I’d like to have the list view to be the default each time I select a project (to avoid the need to click "view all issues and filters" every time I change projects) from the “Projects” dropdown.

Note: this same question was posted here (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15701634/how-can-i-set-the-issue-screen-to-show-the-list-and-not-detail-view-by-default), but there isn't yet an answer.
fields.summary: Default Issue view from the "Projects" menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59261].
  {panel}

The Screen used for a Transition can be defined two different ways:

# In Diagram mode, select the Transition, then click Edit in the pane on the right. This pops up an Edit Transition window with a drop-down for *Screen*
# In Text Mode, select the Transition, then click the Edit button at the top right. This loads a new page to edit the transition with a drop-down for *Transition View*

Also, while in Diagram Mode, select the Transition, then one of the advanced functions such as Validators. From here you can Edit, reaching the same screen as in #2.

There are two problems. First is the inconsistent naming between these, Screen vs. Transition View.

Second, using the Default Classic Workflow, we can see that there's a disconnect between these two fields (Screen and Transition View). Using method #2, edit the Close transition and note that the Transition View is the Resolve screen. Then use method #1 to edit the Close transition and note that the Screen is None.

If you change the screen using method #1 from None to Default Screen, save it, then edit the transition using method #2, you will see that the Transition View has been changed to Default Screen.

This confirms that both Screen and Transition View are the same, but for some reason, the editing window provided by Diagram Mode isn't always displaying the same data as the Text mode.

This affects previous versions of JIRA as well (back to 6.3.5 at least).
fields.summary: Differences in Transition Screen set via Diagram vs. Text modes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59259].
  {panel}

h3. Original Description
In my project, labels are omitted from the view/edit screen. I am aware from JRA-28788 that labels can still be edited within this configuration, but that the pencil icon will not be visible. However:

# When viewing the issue itself (see URL), the pencil icon is absent, as expected. !image-2016-01-06-14-02-28-725.png|thumbnail! - viewing the issue itself now leaves inline editing enabled as a result of the sidebar being present when viewing an issue.
# When viewing the issue from the project issue list, the pencil icon unexpectedly appears. !image-2016-01-06-14-00-48-397.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps

    Turn off Inline Edit in the General Configuration
    Visit a view issue page via the issue navigator
    Click on a field, e.g. priority

h3. Expectation

Nothing happens.

h3. Reality

The field is edited inline.

h3. Notes

The bug is not present in JIRA 6.4.9, but is present in JIRA 7.0.0.
This is also affecting normal issue view in JIRA Cloud v1000.110.0.
fields.summary: Inline edit configuration is not being respected
@mention should prioritize username over the name of the user
Move sub tasks as sub task of another JIRA (Task, Issue or Improvements etc.)
Ability to Customize Components With Colours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59251].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the documentation for [Importing issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html] using External System Import does not mention quite a few of the other options:

!Screen Shot 2016-01-06 at 11.35.41.jpg|thumbnail!

We don't have documentation for any of these.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to include these other importers.

h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59248].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the External System Import does import new users, but nowhere in the documentation ([Importing issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html]) or during the import process does it specify that it will create these users.

The documentation does mention what it will do with newly imported users, but not that it does it in the first place.

The warning also does not occur in the process itself.
The problem here is that it can bring an instance over its licensing limit, and in JIRA Cloud, the new invoice is automatically generated and the billing admin may not see this has happened until they have already been charged.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to specifically mention it will import and create new users, and put along the import process that it will do so and this may cause their bill to go up.
fields.summary: When using External System Import, should warn it will import new users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59237].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When Admin user renames Project and Project Key in JIRA there are a few places where the user must also edit fields in order to keep the naming convention the same across a JIRA instance. 

For example, if a user has a Screens named: ABC: Default Screen Scheme, once the Project name and Key has have been changed to XYZ, the Screen name will no update automatically. 

There is no smart logic that will recognize these text fields and update the related scheme names. Below is the list of fields that *may* need to be corrected after a project title/key change. 

* Issue Types Schemes Titles
* Workflow Schemes Titles
* Screens Schemes Titles
* Permission Schemes Titles

h3. Suggested Solution

Create way to change Scheme Titles upon a Project Name/Key change. This will reduce the amount of manual edits the Admin user will need to make. This will also prevent confusion from legacy project keys and titles in the future. 
 
h3. Workaround 

User must edit the text field manually after changing values for Project Key/Project Name via  JIRA Administration.
fields.summary: Improve Renaming Titles After Changing Project Name and Project Key

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 7 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,
 
Thanks for patience with us. We have identified the root cause of this issue and a fix has already been deployed to JIRA Cloud production. The fix has been deployed to all instances. 

At this point we consider this issue resolved. If you have any questions, please contact Atlassian Support.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández. 
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].
{panel}

h3. Summary

After the upgrade in JIRA on Jan/3/2016, several customers were having a long delay in JIRA Incoming Email Handlers. Which didn't seem to be running.

After analysis, we found that a code change that inadvertently bypassed some bridging code that existed between JIRA's current scheduled job parameter format and the format that existed pre JIRA 7.0.  As a result, schedules that have not been modified since before 7.0 was deployed may not be read correctly by the scheduler.

Editing the service to some other delay and back to '1' rests the Service and fixes the issue:
!minute_service.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
After upgrade, some scheduled jobs are not running.  The Scheduler details page shows that the jobs parameters could not be read.

h3. Expected Results
Remain running as scheduled.

h3. Actual Results
Affected jobs do not run.

h3.Workaround
# In the Services (https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewServices!default.jspa) page, find the affected job.
# Go to the Incoming Email page
# Edit the Mail Handler
# Set the delay to the desired interval the handler should be executed (in minutes).
If the value is already set to 1, simply click on *Next* and *Save*.
# Check in Services page if the Service related to that was update correctly. The Service has the same name.
fields.summary: Services not running for custom Incoming Mail Handlers after upgrade on Jan/3/2016

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59211].
  {panel}

Our JIRA setup supports a large number of business units under our parent company.
Each company has it's own domain (~ 300 domains)
Our JIRA username format is based on the email address.

When trying to @ mention a user, once you get to the @ in the email address, the auto-match stops working

We do this as there's many users with the same firstname at different companies, so if we're looking for alex@companyXXX.com, we can't do it.

We can use [~alex@companyXXX.com] and it'll auto-link and email the user, but for finding the right user in the first place.
fields.summary: JIRA mentions - email as username
Allow Dashboards and Filters to be shared with individuals.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59195].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
JRA-34394 was implemented as an upgrade task to fix incorrect watch counts. However, the upgrade task triggers a reindexing that reindexes all of the available issues in the database, thus slows down the upgrade process.

h4. Suggestion
Only the affected issues (with incorrect watch counts) should be reindexed.
fields.summary: UpgradeTask_Build64001.java should only reindex affected issues
Upgrade tasks should trigger foreground reindexing instead of background reindexing
type filter should work based on "Contains"
